GB 0097 ASSOC 17 British Library of Political and Economic Science: Coefficients, The British Library of Political and Economic Science AIM25 Sep 2000 English Compiled in compliance with General International Standard Archival Description, ISAD(G), second edition, 2000; National Council on Archives Rules for the Construction of Personal, Place and Corporate Names, 1997. The Coefficients, dining club English Coefficients, The 1902-1908 1 volume British Library of Political and Economic Science ASSOC 17

Compiled by Sarah Aitchison as part of the RSLP AIM25 project.

The Coefficients dining club was founded at a dinner given by Beatrice and Sidney Webb in September 1902.

Printed minutes of the Coefficients dining club, 1902-1908, comprising discussions on a set theme introduced by one of the group, including typescript minutes for the dinner of 23 May 1903, introductions to each year, and some programme cards. Members of the club were Leopold Stenett Amery, Lt Carlyon Bellairs, Henry Birchenough, Sir Clinton Edward Dawkins, James Louis Garvin, Sir Edward Grey, 3rd Bt, Richard Burden Haldane, William Albert Samuel Hewins, Halford John Mackinder, Leopold James Maxse, Alfred Milner, Viscount Milner, Henry John Newbolt, William Pember Reeves, Bertrand Arthur William Russell, Michael Ernest Sadler, Arnold John Hugh Smith, Herbert George Wells, and Sidney Webb.

Single item.

Political science Politics Social policy Social reform Amery, Leopold Charles Maurice Stennett, 1873-1955, statesman Bellairs, Carlyon, 1871-1955, RN Commander, politician Birchenough, Sir, Henry, 1853-1937, 1st Baronet Dawkins, Sir, Clinton Edward, 1859-1905, Knight, civil servant Garvin, James Louis, 1868-1947, journalist Grey, Edward, 1862-1933, 1st Viscount Grey of Fallodon, statesman Haldane, Richard Burdon, 1856-1928, 1st Viscount Haldane of Cloan, politician, lawyer and philosopher Hewins, William Albert Samuel, 1865-1931, political economist, historian and politician Mackinder, Sir, Halford John, 1861-1947, Knight, geographer and politician Maxse, Leopold James, 1864-1932, journalist and political writer Milner, Alfred, 1854-1925, 1st Viscount Milner, statesman Newbolt, Sir, Henry John, 1862-1938, Knight, poet and man of letters Reeves, William Pember, 1857-1932, New Zealand journalist and politician Russell, Bertrand Arthur William, 1872-1970, 3rd Earl Russell, philosopher and social reformer Sadler, Sir, Michael Ernest, 1861-1943, Knight, educational pioneer and art patron Smith, Arnold John Hugh, 1881-1964, Captain Webb Martha Beatrice 1858-1943 nee Potter social reformer and historian Webb Sidney James 1859-1947 1st Baron Passfield, social reformer and historian Wells, Herbert George, 1866-1946, author Coefficients, dining club LSE, London School of Economics and Political Science

Unknown.

This collection has been microfilmed and the originals withdrawn from public use for preservation purposes. The microfilm must be used. Apply to Archivist for originals.

Microfilm copies only.

Microfilm made available by Follet Preservation Microfilming Project, 1998. Films are held on open access in the Library (Archives MF 160).

Unlisted.

The BLPES holds the personal papers of Beatrice and Sidney Webb (Ref: Passfield), as well as papers created by them on specific subjects (see Coll Miscs).
